text: Got a call from Dr. Smith's office - he needs a dozen laptop batteries ASAP. Said he'd pay around two thousand five hundred. Log it for the day before yesterday.

RE: Order update - J. Anderson Jr. from accounting finally approved that standing desk purchase. Qty was supposed to be 2 but they want a pair of extra monitor arms too. Total with 10% discount comes to 890 dollars. Process for next Tuesday.

FYI the order from Mrs. O'Connor-Williams got messed up. She wanted wireless earbuds not wired. Corrected: 5 units, paid already via transfer - eight hundred forty nine dollars and ninety nine cents. Original date was March 3rd.
Left a voicemail about the Zhang Wei order. He's buying half a dozen gaming monitors for his company. Budget approved for $4200 total but might negotiate. Tentatively scheduled for end of Q1.
Quick note - Martinez, Carlos A. called back. Wants to cancel the printer order BUT keep the toner cartridges. That's 24 units at roughly a hundred fifty bucks total. Ship whenever.

Per our conversation: The Robertson twins' company needs office chairs. Not sure if it's Michael or Mitchell who signed - just put M. Robertson. They want enough for their team, so like fifteen? Around 3K give or take. Delivery by month end.

URGENT from Prof. Elizabeth Chen-Nakamura: needs replacement projector bulbs for the conference room. University PO covers it. She said two units should suffice. Cost is unclear but budget says max $600. Needed for sometime next week.

So apparently Lt. Col. James R. Bradford (ret.) wants those tactical laptop cases we discussed. Put him down for a baker's dozen - he's paying cash, somewhere in the 400 range. Wants them shipped to arrive before the 15th.

Message from earlier: Tony's assistant called about the webcam situation. Actually it was Tony DeLuca himself who'll pay. Needs like 8 or 9 of them - let's say nine to be safe. Company card for $720 minus the promo code so final is $648. Date TBD but probably this Friday.
The Rev. Dr. Martin's church needs sound equipment. Specifically 4 wireless microphones. Donation-funded so budget is tight - can we do $350? They're flexible on timing, maybe early April?
Hey - remember that bulk order? Customer: Fitzgerald & Sons LLC, contact is Patrick Fitzgerald III. 100 ethernet cables at fifty cents each = $50 total. Already processed yesterday actually.

Spoke with Ms. Yamamoto about the server rack situation. She's with Tanaka Corp but ordering personally. Needs just 1 unit but it's expensive - we quoted nineteen hundred. Delivery window is 2-3 weeks from today.
RE: delayed shipment - Bjorn Eriksson-Lindqvist's order for USB-C hubs finally cleared customs. That's 30 units at $40/pop = twelve hundred total. Mark as shipped three days ago.

Reminder about the Senator's aide - Alexandra Petrov. She needs secure flash drives for the office. Dozen units, government rate applies so final cost is $180. Required delivery: first Monday of next month.

Almost forgot - the guy who goes by 'Big Mike' (real name Michael Thompson Sr.) ordered replacement laptop screens. He manages several repair shops so volume is high: two dozen screens, wholesale at $2,400. Scheduled for mid-March.

Sir Reginald Pemberton IV needs thermal printers for his estate management. Quantity: couple of them. He mentioned something about 'a few hundred pounds' - that's roughly $500 USD. Target date was supposed to be last Wednesday.

Called back by the office of Dr. Aisha Okonkwo-Smith. The medical tablet order is confirmed. Half dozen units at $833.33 each comes to exactly five thousand dollars. Rush delivery needed by day after tomorrow.

From the weekend messages: someone named Sue-Ellen McCarthy wants graphics cards. Her email said '3 or 4' - assume 4 to be safe. Budget is under 2 grand, let's say $1,800. She's traveling so delivery after the 20th.

RE: Corporate order - Hashimoto-san (first name Kenji) from the Tokyo office. He ordered UPS battery backups. Said 'several' which in his previous orders meant 7. Price quoted was Â¥110,000 which is about $750. Deliver whenever convenient.

Per voicemail from Cpt. Sarah O'Brien: needs ruggedized tablets for field work. Qty is definitely 5. Military discount brings total to one thousand one hundred twenty five. Date requested: within the next fortnight.

The complaint from Mr. Jean-Pierre Dubois was resolved. He's NOW ordering (not returning) those mechanical keyboards. Changed quantity from 8 to 10. Refund reversed, charge is EUR 890 = approximately $950 USD. Process for deux jours - that's 2 days from now.

Attn: Archbishop Thomas O'Malley's secretary called again. The display monitors for the conference hall - should be a set of three. Quoted price after charitable discount is 2750 dollars and zero cents. Event is April 1st so ship no later than a week before.

Mixed signals from the Lee family order. It's either Jennifer Lee or her husband Dr. David Lee - invoice says J. Lee. Product: smart home hubs + installation. Qty was 'one for each room' which is 6. Total after tax and install: roughly $1,500. Target: before Thanksgiving.

That influencer @TechGuru_Mike (legal name Michael Santos-Rivera) wants review units. Technically a purchase: 1 high-end laptop. Retail is $3,500 but we're doing creator pricing at twenty-eight hundred flat. Ship ASAP means probably tomorrow.

Confusing email chain resolved: Dame Agatha Worthington needs label printers for her charity. Not 15, not 50 - exactly forty units. Bulk pricing at $8 each = $320 total. She said 'no rush' so enter as end of current quarter.

Heads up - the intern mislabeled the Kowalski order. It's actually Dr. Anna Kowalski-Park, not just 'Kowalski.' She wants noise-cancelling headphones for the research team. Originally said 'a few pairs' then clarified eight. Her grant covers up to $2K so we're charging sixteen hundred. Needs them before the symposium on the 3rd.

So my buddy Raj - full name Rajesh K. Venkataraman - finally pulled the trigger on that home office setup. Just the ergonomic chair though, not the desk. Uno solamente. His wife approved the spend: four hundred and change, call it $425. He said whenever is fine but ideally before his birthday which is Feb 14th.

CORRECTION to previous ticket: Gen. (fmr.) Patricia Hawkins doesn't want 3 but THREE DOZEN portable SSDs. She keeps ordering more every time. Anyway, enterprise rate at $60/unit = twenty-one sixty total. Mark for delivery in the first half of next month.

From the community Slack: user @craftsman_joe (Giuseppe Moretti on the invoice) placed a custom order. He makes furniture so he needs 50 metric rulers - yes fifty, for his workshop. Price is trivial, $1 each so fifty bucks. No deadline mentioned, just said 'whenever you get around to it.'

Wild email from the Sheikh's assistant - they want gold-plated USB drives as conference swag. Client: H.E. Sheikh Abdullah bin Rashid. Quantity: a gross minus a dozen, which if my math is right is 132. VIP pricing at twenty dollars per piece. Grand total = $2,640. Need these before Ramadan starts.

Msg from earlier: the Nguyen twins are confusing everyone again. This order is from Thanh Nguyen (the sister, NOT the brother). Wants portable monitors - the 15-inch ones. She hemmed and hawed and settled on a pair. After the employee referral discount it comes to three-fifty. ETA requested was 'end of sprint' which means next Friday.

The O'Reilly Foundation (contact: Seamus O'Reilly III) submitted a PO for refurbished laptops. Charity gets special pricing: $200 per machine. They need enough for a classroom - that's twenty-five units. Total damage: five thousand. Delivery by start of school year, so before September 1st.

Called about the pending order for Baroness Ingrid von Trapp. Her estate manager confirmed: wireless mesh network nodes. The property needs seven units to cover all buildings. Price: $175 each = twelve twenty-five total. She wants installation done before the summer gala, which is June 21st.

NOTE: this is a repeat customer who goes by 'Mac' but signs as Malcolm X. Williams (no relation). He runs a food truck and needs a rugged tablet with a card reader. Just the one unit. Quoted him $900 but threw in free shipping. He needs it yesterday but realistically early next week.

From sales meeting notes: Ms. Fatima Al-Rashidi from the Dubai office confirmed the bulk webcam order. Not the cheap ones - the 4K models. Her team calculated they need one per cubicle: that's eighteen. Corporate rate is $110 per unit. Let me do the math... $1,980 total. Target install date is two weeks from Monday.
